results.title: Simvastatin Improves Learning and Memory Impairment via Gut-Brain Axis Regulation in an Ovariectomized/D-galactose Alzheimer's Rat Model.
results.text_hl: Also, cell death and @<m>DISEASE_Plaque_Amyloid</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058225 @@@Amyloid plaques@@@ notably decreased in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treated hippocampal tissue.

citations.NLM: Zahedi E, Sanaeierad A, Nikbakhtzadeh M, Roghani M, Zamani E. Simvastatin Improves Learning and Memory Impairment via Gut-Brain Axis Regulation in an Ovariectomized/D-galactose Alzheimer's Rat Model. Behav Brain Res. 2023 Aug 2;():114611. PMID: 37541447
citations.BibTeX: @article{37541447, title={Simvastatin Improves Learning and Memory Impairment via Gut-Brain Axis Regulation in an Ovariectomized/D-galactose Alzheimer's Rat Model.}, author={Zahedi E and Sanaeierad A and Nikbakhtzadeh M and Roghani M and Zamani E}, journal={Behav Brain Res}, pages={114611}}

results.title: Simvastatin is the statin that most efficiently protects against kainate-induced excitotoxicity and memory impairment.
results.text_hl: To this end, we studied @DISEASE_Neurodegenerative_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D019636 @@@neurodegeneration@@@ in a @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model by systemic administration of @CHEMICAL_Kainic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007608 @@@kainate@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ was the most effective statin in reducing the deleterious effects caused by @CHEMICAL_Kainic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007608 @@@kainate@@@, including the severity of @DISEASE_Seizures @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizures@@@, excitotoxicity, oxidative damage, @<m>DISEASE_Plaque_Amyloid</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058225 @@@neuritic dystrophy@@@ and apoptosis in the hippocampus and other limbic structures of the brain cortex.

citations.NLM: Ramirez C, Tercero I, Pineda A, Burgos JS. Simvastatin is the statin that most efficiently protects against kainate-induced excitotoxicity and memory impairment. J Alzheimers Dis. 2011;24(1):161-74. PMID: 21224519
citations.BibTeX: @article{21224519, title={Simvastatin is the statin that most efficiently protects against kainate-induced excitotoxicity and memory impairment.}, author={Ramirez C and Tercero I and Pineda A and Burgos JS}, journal={J Alzheimers Dis}, volume={24}, number={1}, pages={161-74}}

results.title: Simvastatin improves cerebrovascular function and counters soluble amyloid-beta, inflammation and oxidative stress in aged APP mice.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ improved reactivity of cerebral arteries, rescued the blood flow response to neuronal activation, attenuated oxidative stress and @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@, and reduced cortical soluble amyloid-beta (@GENE_APP @GENE_11820 @@@Abeta@@@) levels and the number of @GENE_APP @GENE_11820 @@@Abeta@@@ plaque-related @<m>DISEASE_Plaque_Amyloid</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058225 @@@dystrophic neurites@@@.

citations.NLM: Tong XK, Nicolakakis N, Fernandes P, Ongali B, Brouillette J, Quirion R, Hamel E. Simvastatin improves cerebrovascular function and counters soluble amyloid-beta, inflammation and oxidative stress in aged APP mice. Neurobiol Dis. 2009 Sep;35(3):406-14. PMID: 19524673
citations.BibTeX: @article{19524673, title={Simvastatin improves cerebrovascular function and counters soluble amyloid-beta, inflammation and oxidative stress in aged APP mice.}, author={Tong XK and Nicolakakis N and Fernandes P and Ongali B and Brouillette J and Quirion R and Hamel E}, journal={Neurobiol Dis}, volume={35}, number={3}, pages={406-14}}

results.title: Simvastatin ameliorates cognitive impairments via inhibition of oxidative stress-induced apoptosis of hippocampal cells through the ERK/AKT signaling pathway in a rat model of senile dementia.
results.text_hl: Results of the present study demonstrated that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ significantly improved @DISEASE_Cognition_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D003072 @@@cognitive impairments@@@, memory competence, @<m>DISEASE_Plaque_Amyloid</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058225 @@@amyloid plaques@@@, loss of neurons and synapses, @DISEASE_Diffuse_Neurofibrillary_Tangles_with_Calcification @DISEASE_MESH:D055956 @@@neurofibrillary tangles@@@ and oxidative damage in experimental @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Liu W, Zhao Y, Zhang X, Ji J. Simvastatin ameliorates cognitive impairments via inhibition of oxidative stress-induced apoptosis of hippocampal cells through the ERK/AKT signaling pathway in a rat model of senile dementia. Mol Med Rep. 2018 Jan;17(1):1885-1892. PMID: 29257256
citations.BibTeX: @article{29257256, title={Simvastatin ameliorates cognitive impairments via inhibition of oxidative stress-induced apoptosis of hippocampal cells through the ERK/AKT signaling pathway in a rat model of senile dementia.}, author={Liu W and Zhao Y and Zhang X and Ji J}, journal={Mol Med Rep}, volume={17}, number={1}, pages={1885-1892}}
